unit: Price index (rice per sack in occupation pesos)
sources: University of San Diego - Philippine Economy During Japanese Occupation
notes: Japanese Invasion Money (JIM) / 'Mickey Mouse money'. Pre-war peso pegged at 2:1 to USD. Monthly inflation exceeded 40% by late 1943, 60% by Jan 1944. Rice price increased 137,500% during occupation. Currency became worthless at liberation. GDP fell 70%.
